content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.169 - Executive order no. 169: directing state agencies to act consistently with the upper delaware river management plan

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the State of New York supported Congress'
designation of the Upper Delaware River in 1978 as a Scenic and Recreational

River within the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System; and
WHEREAS, the legislation designating the Upper Delaware

Scenic and Recreational River, P.L. 95-625, called for the preparation of a
management plan for the Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational River (the
"River Management Plan"); and
WHEREAS, the State of New York participated in the
development of the River Management Plan, which was adopted by the Secretary of
the Interior on September 29, 1987; and
WHEREAS, the River Management Plan has the following
objectives: a. To protect and maintain
the unique environmental, cultural and natural resources of the Upper Delaware

River corridor, including the maintenance and improvement of fish and wildlife
habitat and the continued public use and enjoyment of those resources, consistent with maintenance of the social and economic vitality of the area and
the continued protection of private property rights; and
b. To involve local government officials and
citizens in management of the Upper Delaware River, including seeking voluntary
actions and local government cooperation to conserve resources, providing for
planned growth that will maintain the essential character of the river valley, and fostering recognition of the unique character of the river valley; and
WHEREAS, the River Management Plan recommended
implementation by an inter-governmental cooperative agency, the Upper Delaware

Council, through the coordinated enforcement of existing federal, state and
local laws; and
WHEREAS, the Department of Environmental Conservation, as
the State's designee, has been a voting member of the Upper Delaware Council
since January 1988; and
WHEREAS, the River Management Plan calls upon the Governor
of the State of New York and the Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
to assure that our respective states' management activities, programs and
reviews are consistent with and supportive of the River Management Plan; NOW, THEREFORE I MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the powers vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of
the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: I. Designated State Agency

The Department of Environmental Conservation shall
coordinate the implementation by State agencies of the River Management Plan
and it shall receive and administer any federal grants given to the State
intended for that purpose. The Commissioner of Environmental Conservation, or a person
designated by the Commissioner, shall continue to represent the State as a
member of the Upper Delaware Council. II. Cooperation by State Agencies

All State agencies shall act consistently with the River

Management Plan to the extent permitted by applicable law. The Department of

Environmental Conservation shall provide to other State agencies such technical
information and assistance as they may require in order to comply with this

Order. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: March 22, 1993
